publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 2ra l.1–13ra l.21) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 13rb l.1–26vb l.2) III) Anaphoras (fol. 26vb–112vb) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 26vb l.3–32va l.13) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 32va l.14–36ra l.9) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 36ra l.10–46vb l.18) III-4) Anaphora of St Dioscorus (fols. 46vb l.18–49vb l.11) III-5) Anaphora of St John Chrysostom (fols. 49vb l.12–55ra l.15) III-6) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 55ra l.16–63rb l.16) III-7) Anaphora of St Jacob of Serug (fols. 63rb l.16–70vb l.12) III-8) Anaphora of St Athanasius (fols. 70vb l.12–81vb l.18) III-9) Anaphora of St Gregory (fols. 82ra l.1–87vb l.5) III-10) Anaphora of St John, son of Thunder (fols. 87vb l.6–97rb l.16) III-11) Anaphora of St Epiphanius (fols. 97rb l.17–103vb l.13) III-12) Anaphora of St Basil of Caesarea (fols. 103vb l.15–112vb l.7) IV) Regulations concerning prerequisites for participation in the Eucharistic Liturgy (fols. 112vb l.8–113rb l.7)
Additiones 1-3.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 114.0 folios, of which 3.0 blank 1r, 113v, 114v, in 13.0 quires .
21.7 17.3 5.5
supportDesc.condition: The textblock was possibly crudely trimmed in the upper part.

layout.ab: average number; actual numbers range from 20 to 24
Ruling and pricking are mostly not visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote:
Mediocre. Black; red. Walda Museʾabuna Walda Muse is mentioned as the scribe in Additio 2.19th century.
ይካ፡ (or ካ) for ይቤ፡ ካህን፡
ይዲ፡ (or ዲ) for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡
ይሕ፡ (or ሕ) for ይቤ፡ ሕዝብ፡
ዕማ for ዕማሬ፡
ቅ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ (e.g., fol. 42ra l.10-11, in black).

decoDesc.decoNote: Name of St Mary; name of the metropolitan; name of the donor; incipit of all texts (usually alternating lines in black and red); first words of sections and structural parts of texts; abbreviations; the words ጸልዩ፡ (e.g., fol. 25ra, l.6), ዕማሬ፡ (e.g., fol. 19vb, ll.14 and 15); elements of the punctuation signs.
- f. 13ra: Simple, short ornamental band filling the line.

list.item: f. 1va: Donation note. f. 1va: ዝቅዳሴ፡ ዘቂርቆስ፡ ሃራ፡ ዘተሰየጦ፡ ወልደ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ከሙት፡ ኵነኒ፡ መድኀኒተ፡ ነፍሴ፡ ኢትሕድጉኒ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ለዘላለም፡ ሥላሴ። ዘሰረቃ፡ ወዘፈሐቃ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም። f. 1va: This missal of Qirqos Hara was purchased by Walda Śǝllāse (so that it might be) salvation for my soul from condemnation to death. Don’t abandon me the Trinity forever the Trinity. May be condemned forever whoever steals it and erases it.

f. 1va-vb: Donation note.f. 1va-b: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወዘአጽሐፎ፡ አቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ ማርያም፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖሙ፡ መርሃ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት። ወአቡሁ፡ ወልደ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ገብረ፡ ዋህድ፡ ዘርዓ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወእሙ፡ ወለተ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወለተ፡ ጽዮን፡ እምነ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወለተ፡ ኤልሳቤጥ፡ አመተ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ዘተጽሕፈት፡ በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወጳጳስነ፡ አትናቴዎስ፡ ወቄስ፡ ገበዝ፡ ወልደ፡ ኪሮስ፡ ወባሕር፡ ነጋሲ፡ ተወልደ ᎓ መድኅን᎓ ወእኁሁ᎓ ወልደ᎓ ክርስቶስ᎓ ወአቡሆሙ᎓ ገብረ᎓ አደንያስ᎓ ወጸሐፊሃ᎓ አቡነ᎓ ወልደ᎓ ሙሴ። f. 1va-b: Let this book of Walda Śǝllāse which he donated to the Saint Qirqos [Church] and which commissioned ʾabuna Gabra Māryām become a guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. And (for) his father Walda Samuʾel Gabra Wahǝd Zärʿa Ṣǝyon and his mother Walatta Giyorgis, Walatta Ṣǝyon, ʾƎmmǝnä Ṣǝyon, Walatta ʾElsabeṭ, ʾAmata Mikāʾel. It was written in the time of our king Yoḥannǝs and our metropolitan ʾAtnatewos and qesa gabaz Walda Kiros and baḥr nagāśi Tawalda Madḫǝn and his brother Walda Krǝstos and their father Gabra Adänyas and the scribe (is) Walda Muse.

f. 113rbls.9-21: Donation note.f. 113rb ls.9-21: ዝቅዳሴ፡ ዘቂርቆስ፡ ሃራ፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ወልደ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወዘአጽሐፍዋ፡ አቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ ማርያም፡ ወጸሐፊሃ፡ አቡነ፡ ወልደ፡ ሙሴ፡ ዋጋ ፱ ብር᎓ ነው… f. 113rb ls.9-21: This missal of Qirqos Hara which donated Walda Śǝllāse and which commissioned ʾabuna Gabra Māryām and wrote ʾabuna Walda Muse costs 9 bǝrr... The information about the price is in Amharic (9 Bǝrr). The note indicates the names of the donor, the scribe, the commissioner (the same as in Additio 1 and 2) and the price for which the Ms. was purchased by the donor.

- Notes in the upper margin: fols. 35r, 36r, 90v. - Notes in pen, within the main text field: fols. 101v, 102r. - Minor note (pen trial?): fol. 113v. - Short text; words are written without spaces or punctuation signs between them; its meaning is unclear, possibly an exercise in writing (cp. the initial words: ብርዕዘፈቲነ…): fol. 114r. - Pen trials: fols. 1r, 1v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front board broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

origin.origDate: Metropolitan ʾAtnatewos (in tenure 1869-76) mentioned in Additio 1 and on fol. 21rb. Patriarch Demetrius II (Dibä Ṭǝros) (1862-70) mentioned also on fol. 21rb. King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89) mentioned in Additio 2.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Walda Śǝllāse (s. Additiones 1, 2 and 3); but ʾabuna Gabra Māryām is mentioned as the commisioner

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
